result.execSummary:
The defendant Colin Jamieson Gordon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.
**AMENDED 7/14/2016 to reflect correct amount of credit for time served.**
**CORRECTED 3-8-18: CFTS**

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Comply with requirements of Sex Offender Registry and comply with sex offender treatment.  Continue to engage in treatment and cooperate with programming determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.   Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

Notice of Completion of Representation

IT IS ORDERED that the corrected judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Andrea Taylor Cornwall is relieved from further representing Colin Jamieson Gordon in this appeal. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3).

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.
